data.title: South Park Character / Location / User talk etc
data.text: Episodes Original Air Date # Cartman Gets an Anal Probe While the boys are waiting for the school bus, Cartman explains the odd nightmare he had about alien visitors abducting him. Aug 13, 1997 1 Weight Gain 4000 When Cartman's environmental essay wins a national contest, America's sweetheart Kathie Lee Gifford comes to South Park to present the award. Aug 20, 1997 2 Volcano A weekend trip to experience camping, fishing and blowing animals to smithereens is threatened by an erupting volcano and a mysterious creature. Aug 27, 1997 3 Big Gay Al's Big Gay Boat Ride When Stan discovers his new dog Sparky is gay, he becomes so confused he loses his will to play in the Homecoming football game against Middle Park. Sep 3, 1997 4 An Elephant Makes Love to a Pig Kyle isn't allowed to keep his new pet elephant because it's too big. The boys find Dr. Mephesto to try and genetically engineer a smaller elephant. Sep 10, 1997 5 Death Grandpa's sole birthday wish is for Stan to take part in his assisted suicide. Mrs. Broflovski has organized a protest against the boys' favorite TV show Terrance and Phillip. Sep 17, 1997 6 Pinkeye A mishap at the morgue transforms the residents of South Park into brain-eating zombies and threatens the boys' night of trick-or-treating. Oct 29, 1997 7 Damien Shunned by the other kids, the Son of Satan calls upon his father to fight Jesus in the ultimate pay-per-view boxing match between good and evil. Feb 4, 1998 8 Starvin' Marvin The boys are accidentally mailed an African child. Mistaking Cartman for the child, government authorities send him to Ethiopia where he runs into Sally Struthers. Nov 19, 1997 9 Mr. Hankey, the Christmas Poo While South Park Elementary attempts to stage the most non-offensive, non-denominational holiday play, Kyle tries to make people believe in Mr. Hankey. Dec 17, 1997 10 Tom's Rhinoplasty Mr. Garrison deserts the class for a visit to Tom's Rhinoplasty. All the boys compete for the attention of their beautiful substitute teacher Ms. Ellen. Feb 11, 1998 11 Mecha-Streisand The boys' discovery of a prehistoric relic allows Barbara Streisand to transform into a monster that threatens to destroy South Park and the world. Feb 18, 1998 12 Cartman's Mom Is a Dirty Slut Who is Eric Cartman's father? It could be anyone who attended South Park's 12th Annual Drunken Barn Dance. Feb 25, 1998 13 Episodes Original Air Date # Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus In a Terrance and Phillip special, the Canadian duo must save Terrance's daughter Sally and all of Canada from the evil dictator Saddam Hussein. Apr 1, 1998 14 Cartman's Mom Is Still a Dirty Slut The boys wait for Dr. Mephesto to regain consciousness and reveal the identity of Cartman's father. Meanwhile, an unexpected blizzard hits South Park. Apr 22, 1998 15 Chickenlover In order to catch the "Chickenlover", Officer Barbrady must learn how to read. Barbrady resigns and anarchy ensues, so the boys pitch in to help. May 20, 1998 16 Ike's Wee Wee When the boys find out what it means to be circumcised, they try to save Ike from his Bris. The school counselor Mr. Mackey is fired and experiments with drugs. May 27, 1998 17 Conjoined Fetus Lady South Park citizens declare a "Conjoined Twin Myslexia Awareness Week" to help the school nurse. The school's dodgeball team goes to the championships with Pip as their star player. Jun 3, 1998 18 The Mexican Staring Frog of Southern Sri Lanka Jimbo and Ned's efforts to drive up the ratings for their new hunting show threatens to edge out an old favorite, Jesus and Pals. Jun 10, 1998 19 City on the Edge of Forever (Flashbacks) A freak accident leaves the South Park Elementary school bus teetering precariously on the edge of a cliff. To cope, the boys reminisce the good old days. Jun 17, 1998 20 Summer Sucks The entire town is gearing up for the annual 4th of July celebration when a ban on fireworks is imposed. They attempt to create something better. Jun 24, 1998 21 Chef's Chocolate Salty Balls South Park's first film festival attracts crowds of tofu-eating movie lovers to the quiet town, badly affecting Mr. Hankey. Chef makes some money by selling his chocolate salty balls. Aug 19, 1998 22 Chickenpox The parents only have their children's best interests at heart when they arrange for Stan, Kyle and Cartman to be exposed to Kenny's chickenpox virus. Aug 26, 1998 23 Roger Ebert Should Lay Off the Fatty Foods Is the new planetarium a boring place to learn about the solar system, or the scene of a diabolical plot to control the minds of South Park's citizens? Sep 2, 1998 24 Clubhouses Stan and Kyle are psyched to have Wendy and Bebe visit their clubhouse for a game of Truth or Dare, but first they have to build one. Sep 23, 1998 25 Cow Days South Park's 14th Annual Cow Days rodeo and carnival is here, and the boys are determined to win Terrance and Phillip dolls. Meanwhile, the town's cows begin to worship a statue. Sep 30, 1998 26 Chef Aid After a huge loss in court, Chef is left penniless. The boys gather some very famous and talented people in the music industry who want to help their old friend. Oct 7, 1998 27 Spookyfish When Sharon Marsh's Aunt Flo makes a monthly visit, she brings a mysterious pet fish for Stan. Cartman suddenly has a beard and is very nice. Oct 28, 1998 28 Merry Christmas Charlie Manson! Dinner with Cartman's family takes a bizarre twist when Uncle Howard shows up after breaking out of prison with his cellmate Charlie Manson. Dec 9, 1998 29 Gnomes The boys are assigned to write a report with Tweek, a very nervous and highly caffeinated boy who insists gnomes are stealing his underpants. Dec 16, 1998 30 Prehistoric Ice Man Kyle and Stan's friendship is strained after they discover a man frozen in an ice cave and argue about what is best for their "discovery". Jan 20, 1999 31 Episodes Original Air Date # Rainforest Shmainforest The boys travel to Costa Rica as part of the "Getting Gay with Kids" choir tour campaigning to save the rainforest. They subsequently get lost. Apr 7, 1999 32 Spontaneous Combustion When South Park citizens start randomly exploding, the mayor enlists the town's only geologist Randy Marsh to find the cause and solution. Stan, Kyle and Cartman reenact the Stations of the Cross. Apr 14, 1999 33 The Succubus When Chef gets engaged, the boys become concerned of his different personality and his evil fiancee. Cartman suffers from vision problems. Apr 21, 1999 34 Tweek Vs. Craig The boys try to instigate a fight between Tweek and Craig. Meanwhile, Mr. Adler the shop teacher is haunted by a recurring dream of his lost love. Jun 23, 1999 35 Jakovasaurs The boys discover a prehistoric creature called a Jakovasaur while camping at Stark's Pond. The town tries to save the species from extinction. Jun 16, 1999 36 Sexual Harassment Panda A giant panda mascot educates the children on sexual harassment. Cartman sues Stan for sexual harassment, which eventually leads to everyone in South Park suing each other. Jul 7, 1999 37 Cat Orgy While all the adults gather at Mr. Mackey's house to watch the meteor shower, Shelly Marsh babysits for Cartman and invites her much-older boyfriend over. Cartman's cat is in heat. Jul 14, 1999 38 Two Guys Naked in a Hot Tub Stan is dragged to Mr. Mackey's meteor shower party and sent down into the basement to play with Pip, Butters and Dougie. Randy and Gerald share an intimate moment in a hot tub. Jul 21, 1999 39 Jewbilee Kyle invites Kenny to join him and Ike at Jewbilee, a camp for Jewish kids, where they summon Moses. Meanwhile, an evil plot to release Haman is at hand. Jul 28, 1999 40 Chinpokomon The boys and their classmates are caught up in the latest fad from Japan called Chinpokomon that contains subliminal propaganda to bring down the American government. Nov 3, 1999 41 Starvin' Marvin in Space Starvin' Marvin returns to South Park with an alien spaceship and enlists Cartman, Stan, Kyle and Kenny's help to seek out a new home for his starving people. Nov 17, 1999 42 Korn's Groovy Pirate Ghost Mystery Korn comes to South Park for a Halloween concert and helps the boys solve a spooky pirate ghost mystery. Oct 27, 1999 43 Hooked on Monkey Fonics To help Cartman win the school spelling bee, Cartman's Mom gives him the Hooked on Monkey Fonics spelling system. Nov 10, 1999 44 The Red Badge of Gayness Cartman has visions of glory as he suits up for the Confederacy in the annual reenactment of a Civil War battle, and leads the drunken rebels to defeat the union. Nov 24, 1999 45 Mr. Hankey's Christmas Classics An extravaganza of holiday songs are performed in unique South Park style, hosted by Mr. Hankey. Dec 1, 1999 46 Are You There, God? It's Me, Jesus People from all over the world start to gather outside Jesus' house waiting for a millennium miracle. Dec 29, 1999 47 World Wide Recorder Concert The children of South Park are invited to Arkansas for the "Four Million Child Blow 2000," the first worldwide recorder concert. Jan 12, 2000 48 Episodes Original Air Date # Cartman's Silly Hate Crime 2000 Cartman is pursued by the FBI for committing a hate crime and lands in juvenile hall. Apr 12, 2000 49 The Tooth Fairy's Tats 2000 When Cartman discovers the Tooth Fairy is paying a premium price for his lost teeth, he and the boys seize the opportunity to make some cash. Apr 5, 2000 50 Quintuplets 2000 8-year-old contorting quintuplets from Romania defect to the United States and seek shelter with Stan's family. Apr 26, 2000 51 Timmy 2000 When Timmy is diagnosed with Attention Deficit Disorder, it triggers a wave of prescription drug abuse at South Park Elementary. Apr 19, 2000 52 Pip When Pip is offered the opportunity to become a gentleman he goes to London only to discover that Miss Havisham plans to break his heart. Nov 29, 2000 53 Cartman Joins NAMBLA Cartman decides to seek friendship using the Internet, and finds an older man who is more than willing to be his friend...and more. Jun 21, 2000 54 Cherokee Hair Tampons Kyle needs a kidney transplant and Cartman is a discovered to be the perfect donor. Cartman gladly offers his kidney to Kyle -- for the price of $10 million dollars. Jun 28, 2000 55 Chef Goes Nanners Chef's passionate protest declaring the South Park flag racist enflames the entire town. Jul 5, 2000 56 Something You Can Do With Your Finger "Fingerbang" is the newest boy band starring all the boys and it's also Cartman's latest scheme to make a million dollars. Jul 12, 2000 57 Do the Handicapped Go to Hell? The boys learn in Sunday school that they must confess their sins, but worry about Timmy since all he can say is his own name. Jul 19, 2000 58 Probably Cartman's flock begins to grow and the children begin plans to build him a Church. Meanwhile, Satan turns to God for advice. Jul 26, 2000 59 Fourth Grade The boys devise a plan to travel back in time a full year and return to the third grade, with the help of Timmy and his electronic wheelchair. Nov 8, 2000 60 Trapper Keeper When he finally stops bragging about his new Trapper Keeper, a stranger informs him that it will eventually take over the world and destroy humankind, if they don't destroy it first. Nov 15, 2000 61 Helen Keller! The Musical When Butters informs the forth grader's that the Kindergarteners school play is a magnificent sight to behold, they go through a lot of pain to make sure they beat the tiny tots' show. Nov 22, 2000 62 Fat Camp Cartman's family and friends have intervened and are forcing him to trim down. While Cartman's away, Kenny's star is on the rise when he gets his own reality TV show. Dec 6, 2000 63 The Wacky Molestation Adventure To get back at his parents for not letting him go to a concert, Kyle tells the police that his parents molested him. Soon, the whole town is free of adults and divided into two rival cities Dec 13, 2000 64 A Very Crappy Christmas When Mr. Hankey skips Christmas, the boys find him living with his alcoholic wife and their three little nuggets. He tells them that no one is into Christmas anymore Dec 20, 2000 65 Episodes Original Air Date # It Hits the Fan The you-know-what hits the fan 162 times when the citizens of South Park tune in to hear the word "shit" on a popular TV shows. Jun 20, 2001 66 Cripple Fight Big Gay Al returns to South Park as the new scout leader. When he is fired for being gay, the boys rally to his defense with the help of the new "handi-capable" kid, Jimmy. Jun 27, 2001 67 Super Best Friends Teaming up with Jesus, Stan calls upon all the Super Best Friends to destroy the evil cult leader and magician David Blaine and thwart the mass suicide pact he has planned. Jul 4, 2001 68 Scott Tenorman Must Die After the other boys explain to Cartman that pubes don't count unless you grow your own, Cartman realizes he's been tricked by the school bully, Scott Tenorman. Jul 11, 2001 69 Terrance and Phillip: Behind the Blow When the boys discover Terrance and Philip have called it quits, they'll go to any lengths to reunite the duo and recruit them for South Park's Earth Day festivities. Jul 18, 2001 70 Cartmanland Cartman inherits a million dollars from his grandmother and fulfills his lifelong dream of owning his own amusement park: Cartmanland! Jul 25, 2001 71 Proper Condom Use In a time-honored tradition and right-of-passage, the boys are separated from the girls and schooled in the mysteries of sex by none other than Mr. Mackey. Aug 1, 2001 72 Towelie When the government steals their new Gamesphere, the boys will stop at nothing to get it back. Aug 8, 2001 73 Osama bin Laden Has Farty Pants The kids of South Park have raised money to send to children of Afghanistan, but the Government believes the Afghani children's thank you gift is contaminated with Anthrax and the boys are forced to take it back to Afghanistan. Nov 7, 2001 74 How To Eat With Your Butt Cartman gets Kenny's school picture on every "missing child" milk carton in the country. Nov 14, 2001 75 The Entity Mr. Garrison gets fed up with long lines, delayed flights and the airline industry in general and invents his own transportation device. Nov 21, 2001 76 Here Comes the Neighborhood Tolkien is tired of being the only rich kid in town, and succeeds in attracting several other wealthy families to South Park Nov 28, 2001 77 Kenny Dies In a very special episode of "South Park," Cartman fights for Kenny's life when he speaks before Congress in favor of stem-cell research. Dec 5, 2001 78 Butters' Very Own Episode Alone and lost, Butters determinedly makes his way through porn theatres and gay bath houses in an effort to get his dad back home in time to eat at Bennigan's for his parents' anniversary. Dec 12, 2001 79 Episodes Original Air Date # Freak Strike When the boys learn that talk shows offer prizes to people who are grossly disfigured they can't sign Butters up fast enough. Mar 20, 2002 80 Jared Has Aides As the country becomes obsessed with a popular program for losing weight, the boys see an opportunity to become sponsored by a major restaurant chain. Mar 6, 2002 81 Asspen While the adults are trapped at a time-share sales meeting, Stan is challenged by the best skier on the mountain. Mar 13, 2002 82 The New Terrance and Phillip Movie Trailer All the kids in South Park are glued to the TV, wild with anticipation to see the first trailer for the latest Terrance and Phillip movie. Apr 3, 2002 83 Fun with Veal Stan is appalled when he realizes the veal he's been eating is, in fact, the meat from little baby calves. Mar 27, 2002 84 Professor Chaos The boys fire Butters as their new friend. Devastation over his rejection unleashes Butters' dark side and Professor Chaos is born. Apr 10, 2002 85 The Simpsons Already Did It Professor Chaos is frustrated when he realizes all of his diabolical plans to wreak havoc on South Park have already been done by "The Simpsons". Jun 26, 2002 86 Red Hot Catholic Love A sexual abuse scandal involving priests hits South Park and is taken all the way to the Vatican. Jul 3, 2002 87 Free Hat When the boys find out that their favorite movies are being enhanced, re-released and ruined in the process, they form a club to "Save Films from their Directors". Jul 10, 2002 88 Bebe's Boobs Destroy Society Bebe is the first girl in the fourth grade to "develop". Her new little breasts inspire a primate-like reaction from all the boys in class that threaten their friendship and society in general. Jul 17, 2002 89 Child Abduction is Not Funny In an effort to protect their children from kidnappers, the parents hire the owner of City Wok Restaurant to build the Great Wall of South Park. Jul 24, 2002 90 A Ladder to Heaven Kenny died with the winning ticket to a prize of endless candy in his pocket. The boys decide to build a ladder to Heaven where they expect to find him and get the ticket back. Nov 6, 2002 91 The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers The boys embark upon a mythical quest as they set out to return their copy of the "The Lord of the Rings" movie to their local video store. Nov 13, 2002 92 The Death Camp of Tolerance The boys are sentenced to the Death Camp of Tolerance where they learn how to treat minorities. Mr. Slave and Lemmiwinks make their debut in this episode. Nov 20, 2002 93 The Biggest Douche in the Universe When a famous psychic fails to help him exorcise Kenny from his body, Cartman and Chef travel to the moors of Scotland, where Chef's mom tries a little of her voodoo magic on him. Nov 27, 2002 94 My Future Self 'n' Me When a 32-year-old man claiming to be Stan from the future shows up in South Park, young Stan is forced to come to terms with the loser he will become. Dec 4, 2002 95 Red Sleigh Down Cartman has to score one big "nice" to be eligible for Christmas presents this year. He recruits Santa, Mr. Hankey and Jesus in a desperate attempt to bring Christmas to the downtrodden citizens of Iraq. Dec 11, 2002 96 Episodes Original Air Date # I'm a Little Bit Country The boys join some anti-war protesters because it's a free pass out of school for the day. Apr 9, 2003 97 Krazy Kripples Jimmy and Timmy pull together a group of people like themselves and call their new club the "Crips". Mar 26, 2003 98 Toilet Paper Cartman convinces the boys to "toilet paper" their teacher's house, but Kyle is overwhelmed with guilt. Apr 2, 2003 99 Cancelled Stan, Cartman, Kyle and Kenny find out that planet Earth is just one big intergalactic reality show and it's about to be cancelled. Mar 19, 2003 100 Fat Butt and Pancake Head One of Cartman's body parts becomes famous overnight and rivals the popularity of another superstar. Apr 16, 2003 101 Lil' Crime Stoppers After they return a missing doll to a little girl, the police department recognizes the boys' efforts and officially names them, "junior deputies." Apr 23, 2003 102 Red Man's Greed The citizens of South Park are being forced off their land to make way for a new super highway after owners of the Three Feathers Indian Casino acquire the town. Apr 30, 2003 103 South Park Is Gay The town of South Park celebrates the new, hip metro-sexual craze. Oct 22, 2003 104 Christian Rock Hard When the other boys kick Cartman out of their band, he pulls his own group together to make music for Jesus. Oct 29, 2003 105 Grey Dawn With South Park's senior citizens behind the wheel, more than a few farmer's markets have been mowed down. Unwilling to surrender their driver's licenses, the elderly fight back. Nov 5, 2003 106 Casa Bonita Kyle chooses Stan, Kenny and Butters to celebrate his birthday at Casa Bonita. When Cartman finds out he's not invited, he arranges for Butters to conveniently go "missing". Nov 12, 2003 107 All About Mormons A Mormon kid moves to South Park and it's up to Stan to kick his ass. But when Stan and his dad meet their new Mormon neighbors, they become fascinated with how genuinely nice they are. Nov 19, 2003 108 Butt Out After singing and dancing representatives from an anti-smoking campaign rap about the dangers of smoking, the kids at South Park Elementary realize how cool it really is and take up the habit. Dec 3, 2003 109 Raisins After Wendy breaks up with Stan the boys take him to "Raisins", a local restaurant known for its great chicken wings and hot girls. Dec 10, 2003 110 It's Christmas in Canada The town decides to cancel Christmas and take up a collection when Ike's Canadian birth parents show up unexpectedly and want their baby back. Dec 17, 2003 111 Episodes Original Air Date # Good Times With Weapons The boys are transformed into Japanese Warriors after they trick a vendor and buy martial arts weapons at a local flea market. Mar 17, 2004 112 AWESOM-O Cartman plans to learn all of Butters' innermost secrets and then use them against him, by pretending to be Butters' new best friend, a robot named AWESOM-O. Apr 14, 2004 113 Up the Down Steroid Jimmy is in training for the upcoming Special Olympics and he's determined to win at any cost Mar 24, 2004 114 The Passion of the Jew Kyle finally sees the blockbuster movie "The Passion of the Christ" and admits that Cartman has been right about the Jewish people all along. Mar 31, 2004 115 You Got F'd in the A Stan just got served, and now it's up to him to put together a team of South Park's best dancers to compete against a troupe from Orange County. Apr 7, 2004 116 Goobacks Humans from the year 3045 are traveling to South Park through a recently opened time portal and are looking for work. Apr 28, 2004 117 The Jeffersons The children of South Park are attracted to "Mr. Jefferson" the new neighbor in town, and Cartman goes out of his way to get "Mr. Jefferson" to love him best. Apr 21, 2004 118 Douche and Turd A PET protest against the use of a cow as South Park Elementary's mascot forces the student body to choose a new one. Oct 27, 2004 119 Something Wall Mart This Way Comes In order to save South Park, Stan and Kyle have to find a way to destroy the ever-expanding Wall Mart superstore while keeping Cartman from stabbing them in the back. Nov 3, 2004 120 Pre-School The kid who took the fall for the boys five years ago is getting out of Juvie, and his first order of business is revenge Nov 10, 2004 121 Quest for Ratings The boys of South Park produce their own morning news show on the school's closed-circuit television station and are immediately caught up in an intense competition for ratings. Nov 17, 2004 122 Stupid Spoiled Whore Video Playset Disturbed by the corruptive influence Paris Hilton has on all little girls in South Park, one of the town's favorite citizens challenges her to a "whore-off." Dec 1, 2004 123 Cartman's Incredible Gift After sustaining a severe head injury, Cartman appears to have the power to see into the future. South Park detectives are quick to enlist his help in cracking unsolved murder cases. Dec 8, 2004 124 Woodland Critter Christmas Stan agrees to help a group of adorable woodland critters build a manger in anticipation of the birth of their Lord and Savior, only to find out that they serve Satan. Dec 15, 2004 125 Episodes Original Air Date # Mr. Garrison's Fancy New Vagina As Mr. garrison enjoys his new womanly attributes after his sex change, the rest of the town gets in touch with their inner feelings too. Mar 9, 2005 126 Die Hippie, Die When hippie drum circles start popping up in people's attics and backyards the citizens of South Park have no choice but to turn to Eric Cartman for help. Mar 16, 2005 127 Wing The boys set up a talent agency and pool all their resources and impress their first client only to have another agency steal him away. Mar 23, 2005 128 Best Friends Forever When Kenny meets with an unfortunate accident, Cartman lobbies to let Kenny die so he can can get what Kenny left to him in Kenny's will. Mar 30, 2005 129 The Losing Edge The kids desperately want an end to the boring baseball season. The problem is, they keep winning. Apr 6, 2005 130 The Death of Eric Cartman Cartman is sure he's dead and Butters is sure that Eric Cartman's ghost is haunting him. Together they attempt to make amends to all the people Cartman has wronged over the years. Apr 13, 2005 131 Erection Day The South Park Elementary School Talent Show is coming up and Jimmy can't wait to perform his comedy routine, but first he must find a way to gain control of his raging hormones. Apr 20, 2005 132 Two Days Before the Day After Tomorrow A Global Warming State is Emergency is declared in South Park as the world's largest beaver dam breaks and floods the adjacent town of Beaverton. Oct 19, 2005 133 Marjorine Butters must fake his death, dress up as a girl and infiltrate a slumber party, in order to retrieve a future telling device Cartman is convinced the girls have. Oct 26, 2005 134 Follow That Egg In an effort to thwart her ex-lovers plans to get married, Mrs. Garrison leads the charge against gay marriage. Nov 2, 2005 135 Ginger Kids After the sudden on-set of the disease Gingervitis, Cartman rallies all other ginger kids to rise up and assume their role as the master race. Nov 9, 2005 136 Trapped in the Closet Scientologists converge on Stan's house after he is identified as the reincarnation of L. Ron Hubbard. One A-lister locks himself in the closet and refuses to come out, after Stan criticizes his "talent." Nov 16, 2005 137 Free Willzyx The boys try to rescue their new friend Willzyx, a talking space whale, from the Denver Sea Park and with the help of MASA (Mexican Aeronautica y Spacia Administracion) get him home to the moon for $200. Nov 30, 2005 138 Bloody Mary Stan is embarrassed when his dad gets pulled over for drunk driving. Randy believes that only one thing can save him from his "disease," a bleeding statue of the Virgin Mary in the next town. Dec 7, 2005 139 Episodes Original Air Date # The Return of Chef Chef returns to South Park after spending time away with a group called, "The Super Adventure Club", but when his strange behavior starts getting him in trouble, the boys risk everything to save him. Mar 22, 2006 140 Smug Alert Kyle and his family are moving to San Francisco. The only way Stan can get his best friend back is to convince everyone to start driving hybrid cars. Mar 29, 2006 141 Cartoon Wars Part I When the creators of the Family Guy announce that they will show the image of a religious symbol, the network threatens to ban the episode. Cartman sees this as his chance to get "Family Guy" off the air for good. Apr 5, 2006 142 Cartoon Wars Part II After leaving Kyle injured on the side of the road, Cartman races to the headquarters of "Family Guy" determined to put an end to the show once and for all. Apr 12, 2006 143 A Million Little Fibers Towelie gets over his drug addition and writes his memoirs. With Oprah's support, his book becomes a best seller and his story inspires millions to turn their lives around. Apr 19, 2006 144 ManBearPig Al Gore warns the school about the threat of ManBearPig. Apr 26, 2006 145 Tsst! When Cartman's mom realizes she can't control her son anymore, she gets help from an expert. The "Dog Whisperer" may have what it takes but Eric Cartman's not going down without a fight. May 3, 2006 146 Make Love, Not Warcraft There's trouble in the online gaming world when a mad gamer won't play by the rules. The boys dedicate their lives to defeating the renegade and saving the World of Warcraft. Oct 4, 2006 147 Mystery of the Urinal Deuce The world's biggest conspiracy of all time is finally uncovered when Eric Cartman exposes the true culprit behind the September 11th attacks. Oct 11, 2006 148 Miss Teacher Bangs a Boy In his new role as School Hallway Monitor at South Park Elementary, Cartman must team up with Kyle when they discover a teacher having sex with a student. Oct 18, 2006 149 Hell on Earth 2006 Satan is throwing the biggest Halloween costume party ever. Just like a girl getting ready for her sweet sixteen, every detail must be perfect for the prince of darkness. The antics of the most notorious serial killers of all time threaten his fun. Oct 25, 2006 150 Go God Go South Park Elementary faces strong opposition to the topic of evolution. Cartman's too busy to notice as he plans to propel himself into the future on the precise release date of the newest, hottest game console. Nov 1, 2006 151 Go God Go XII Eric Cartman has frozen himself in an attempt to make his three-week wait for a Nintendo Wii pass quickly. A freak accident landed him over 500 years in the future and now, he's stuck in a Godless world on the brink of war with no Nintendo Wii. Nov 8, 2006 152 Stanley's Cup Stan Marsh has hit rock bottom. He's got no job, no bicycle and his only way out of a bad situation is to coach the local pee wee hockey team. But Marsh is still living with the memory of how he let his team down when he missed the winning shot in the big game. Nov 15, 2006 153 Episodes Original Air Date # With Apologies to Jesse Jackson Randy Marsh tries to find forgiveness after mistakenly using a racial slur on "Wheel of Fortune". Meanwhile, Cartman fights a midget. Mar 7, 2007 154 Cartman Sucks Cartman invites Butters over for the night and plans to do disgusting things to him in his sleep. However, when he photographs Butters' penis in his mouth, there are drastic consequences for both boys. Mar 14, 2007 155 Lice Capades When Mrs. Garrison refuses to name names about an infestation of head lice that plagues South Park Elementary, Cartman finds a way to detect who has lice. Mar 21, 2007 156 The Snuke When a new Muslim student joins the class, Cartman immediately suspects him of being a terrorist. Mar 28, 2007 157 Fantastic Easter Special Stan starts asking his Dad some tough questions about the origins of Easter. The answers lead to an ancient and mysterious secret society created in the Middle Ages to protect the secret of the Easter Bunny. Apr 4, 2007 158 D-Yikes! When the bar Mrs. Garrison hangs out in is about to be taken over by Persian club owners, she fights to save the one place that lets her be the woman she is. Apr 11, 2007 159 Night of the Living Homeless Ignoring the homeless in South Park becomes impossible when their numbers become overwhelming and their lust for spare change becomes insatiable. Apr 18, 2007 160 Le Petit Tourette Faking Tourette's Syndrome and saying whatever he wants without getting in trouble, Cartman lines up an appearance with Chris Hansen on "Dateline NBC." Oct 3, 2007 161 More Crap Stan's dad Randy becomes South Park's hometown hero when the guys down at the local bar see the size of his most recent crap. Oct 10, 2007 162 Imaginationland When the entire contents of the world's imagination lay open before them, Stan and Kyle step right in. Back in South Park, Cartman swears he's seen a leprechaun. Oct 17, 2007 163 Imaginationland, Episode II After the wall in Imaginationland is blown up by terrorists, the evil side crosses over. Cartman tracks down Kyle and Stan at the Pentagon and demands Kyle makes good on their agreement. Meanwhile, U.S. troops cross over into Imaginationland while evil characters cross over into reality. Oct 24, 2007 164 Imaginationland, Episode III Inside Imaginationland, Stan and Butters engage in the battle of their lives as they fight the army of evil imaginary forces. Meanwhile, Cartman goes all the way to the Supreme Court to get Kyle to pay up on their bet. Oct 31, 2007 165 Guitar Queer-O When Stan and Kyle get hooked on Guitar Hero, Stan's superior skills put their friendship in danger. Nov 7, 2007 166 The List The girls in the fourth grade class have made a secret list that rates every boy's looks from cutest to ugliest. The boys steal the list, but are unprepared to deal with the results. Nov 14, 2007 167 Episodes Original Air Date # Tonsil Trouble After a routine tonsillectomy goes horribly wrong, Cartman comes face to face with his own mortality. Mar 12, 2008 168 Britney's New Look When the boys help Britney Spears get to the North Pole, they discover the shocking secret behind her popularity. Mar 19, 2008 169 Major Boobage In a South Park homage to the 1981 film, "Heavy Metal", the boys are trying to get Kenny off the latest drug craze that's captured the junior high and under set. Mar 26, 2008 170 Canada on Strike The head of the World Canadian Bureau leads the country into a long and painful strike and the responsibility of brokering a settlement rests with the boys. Apr 2, 2008 171 Eek, A Penis! While Ms. Garrison is off trying to find a way to become the man he was always intended to be, Cartman is put in charge of the classroom. Apr 9, 2008 172 Over Logging One day the citizens of South Park wake up and find the internet is gone. When Randy hears there may still be some internet out in California, he packs up his family and heads west. Apr 16, 2008 173 Super Fun Time While the kids are on an educational field trip to a living museum, Cartman makes Butters sneak away from the class to go to the amusement center located next door. Apr 23, 2008 174 The China Probrem With the rest of the American people haunted by the memory of a recent tragic event, only Butters will stand with Cartman as he confronts the Chinese. Oct 8, 2008 175 Breast Cancer Show Ever Wendy gets in trouble when she threatens to beat up Cartman after school. Oct 15, 2008 176 Pandemic While the world struggles to contain an epidemic of epic proportions, the boys find a way to make money off of it. Oct 22, 2008 177 Pandemic 2: The Startling Giant guinea pigs are attacking cities all over the world. The boys have the key that will save everyone from the onslaught but they're stranded in the Andes Mountains. Oct 29, 2008 178 About Last Night...
